wackpackr.core

Class HuffTreeParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • wackpackr.core.HuffTreeParser

  • public class HuffTreeParser
extends Object
    Helper class that handles forming and parsing of frequency-sorted prefix trees needed in Huffman compression and decompression.
    Author:
    Juho Juurinen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HuffTreeParser() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static HuffNode buildTree(byte[] bytes)
      Reads the given byte array and creates an optimal Huffman tree, based on the frequency of appearance of each byte in the array.
      static HuffNode decodeTree(BinaryIO io)
      Reads Huffman tree from given input stream, and returns pointer to root node of the tree.
      static void encodeTree(HuffNode node, BinaryIO io)
      Stores the given Huffman tree to the given output stream using pre-order traversal, such that internal nodes are encoded as 0, and leaf nodes as 1 followed by the byte value of that leaf.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • HuffTreeParser

        public HuffTreeParser()

    • Method Detail

      • buildTree

        public static HuffNode buildTree(byte[] bytes)
        Reads the given byte array and creates an optimal Huffman tree, based on the frequency of appearance of each byte in the array. A pseudo-EoF marker is included in the tree by default.
        Parameters:
        bytes - raw data as byte array
        Returns:
        pointer to root node of resultant Huffman tree

      • encodeTree

        public static void encodeTree(HuffNode node,
                              BinaryIO io)
                       throws IOException
        Stores the given Huffman tree to the given output stream using pre-order traversal, such that internal nodes are encoded as 0, and leaf nodes as 1 followed by the byte value of that leaf.
        Parameters:
        node - pointer to root node of Huffman tree
        io - I/O wrapper holding the output stream to which tree is encoded
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's an error writing to the output stream

      • decodeTree

        public static HuffNode decodeTree(BinaryIO io)
                           throws IOException
        Reads Huffman tree from given input stream, and returns pointer to root node of the tree.

        Assumes that the immediate next sequence of bits in the input stream contains a Huffman tree encoded in a specific manner, followed by the prefix code of the pseudo-EoF node.

        Parameters:
        io - I/O wrapper holding the input stream from which tree is decoded
        Returns:
        pointer to root node of decoded Huffman tree
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's an error reading the input stream
